title: In charts: has the Woodford saga already killed off active fund managers?
text:
As the dust settles on the Neil Woodford saga thoughts inevitably turn to what the long-term fallout will be.

Many have suggested the failure of the former star manager will further knock the confidence held in "active" managers, those who pick their own stocks and assets, and accelerate the move to passive investing, where far cheaper funds simply mirror an entire index.

The logic is sound. Neil Woodford's demise could cost investors who are stuck in the fund nearly half their money – a far cry from the market-beating returns they were promised.

This, combined with only 39 of 345 British company fund beating the FTSE All Share – a broad measure of the London stock market – so far this year,...
description: As the dust settles on the Neil Woodford saga thoughts inevitably turn to what the long-term fallout will be.
